Module com.paint.paint
Package com.paint.paint

Class Display

java.lang.Object
com.paint.paint.Display
public class Display extends Object

Display.java handles displaying content in the application, including images, canvases, popup windows, etc.

Since:
0.2.0

  • Field Details

    • activeCanvas

      public static javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas activeCanvas
      activeCanvas object to store which canvas is currently active for editing.

    • firstTab

      public static boolean firstTab
      firstTab boolean stores if there has been a tab created or not.

    • unsavedChanges

      public static boolean unsavedChanges
      unsavedChanges boolean tracks whether changes have been made since the last save.

  • Constructor Details

    • Display

      public Display()

  • Method Details

    • setUnsavedChanges

      public static void setUnsavedChanges(boolean condition)

      This method sets the unsaved changes boolean to true or false. This is set by the Controller cursorUpdate() method and reset by the Controller save() and saveAs() methods

      Parameters:
      condition - the input argument, either true or false, that unsavedChanges will be set to.
      Since:
      2.3.1

    • getUnsavedChanges

      public static boolean getUnsavedChanges()

      This method simply gets the status of the unsavedChanges boolean for use in other methods.

      Returns:
      the status of the unsavedChanges boolean.
      Since:
      2.3.1

    • showSaveWarning

      public static void showSaveWarning(javafx.scene.control.TabPane tabPane, javafx.scene.control.Tab activeTab)

      This method is called to show a warning dialogue window when you try to close a tab with unsaved changes. It takes in a parent tab pane and the active tab.

      Parameters:
      tabPane - Used for finding the parent stage for the window to be displayed in.
      activeTab - Used so that the user can override the message and close the tab.
      Since:
      2.3.1

    • showImage

      public static void showImage(javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas canvas, javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext graphContext, String path)

      This method is used to display an image on the active canvas. It takes in the canvas for the image to be displayed on, the graphics context of that canvas, and the path of the image to be opened.

      Parameters:
      canvas - the canvas that the image will be displayed on
      graphContext - the graphics context of that canvas, for drawing the image
      path - the path of the image file
      Since:
      0.2.0

    • newTab

      public static javafx.scene.control.Tab newTab(javafx.scene.control.TabPane tabPane, String name)

      This method is part of a group of several methods all used internally within the createNewTab() method. This method creates a new tab, names it, sets closing behavior, and adds it to the parent TabPane.

      Parameters:
      tabPane - the TabPane for the tab to be added to.
      name - the name that the tab will be given.
      Returns:
      newTab, the newly created tab.
      Since:
      2.1.1

    • newScroll

      public static javafx.scene.control.ScrollPane newScroll(javafx.scene.control.Tab tab)

      This method is part of a group of several methods all used internally within the createNewTab() method. This particular method creates a new ScrollPane within a given tab. This method creates a new ScrollPane, and adds it to a pre-existing tab. It also adds a listener to whether or not the tab is selected, for use in determining the active canvas.

      Parameters:
      tab - the tab for the ScrollPane to be added to
      Returns:
      newScroll, the newly created ScrollPane
      Since:
      2.1.1

    • newStack

      public static javafx.scene.layout.StackPane newStack(javafx.scene.control.ScrollPane scrollPane)

      This method is part of a group of several methods all used internally within the createNewTab() method. This particular method creates a new StackPane and places it on a pre-existing ScrollPane.

      Parameters:
      scrollPane - the ScrollPane for the StackPane to be added to.
      Returns:
      newStack, the newly created StackPane.
      Since:
      2.4.0

    • newCanvas

      public static javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas newCanvas(javafx.scene.layout.StackPane stackPane)

      This method is part of a group of several methods all used internally within the createNewTab() method. This particular method creates a new Canvas to be added to a pre-existing StackPane. This method defines the starting parameters for the Canvas, as well as setting a new cursor for when the mouse cursor is over the Canvas.

      Parameters:
      stackPane - the StackPane for the Canvas to be added to.
      Returns:
      newCanvas, the newly created canvas.
      Since:
      2.1.1

    • createNewTab

      public static void createNewTab(javafx.scene.control.TabPane tabPane, String tabName)

      This method uses the newTab, newScroll, newStack, and newCanvas methods sequentially to create a new tab and add the appropriate components to it for correct functioning of the application.

      Parameters:
      tabPane - the parent TabPane for the tab to be created.
      tabName - the name that will be given to the tab when it is created.
      Since:
      2.1.1

    • getActiveCanvas

      public static javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas getActiveCanvas()

      This method returns the canvas that is currently active for editing.

      Returns:
      activeCanvas, the current active canvas for editing.
      Since:
      2.1.1

    • clearActiveCanvas

      public static void clearActiveCanvas(javafx.scene.control.TabPane tabPane, javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas activeCanvas)

      This method takes in the parent TabPane and the active canvas, and will clear the active canvas of all images and drawn objects. It will display a warning message asking the user if they are sure they want to clear the canvas.

      Parameters:
      tabPane - the parent TabPane for the warning message to be displayed in.
      activeCanvas - the canvas to be cleared.

    • updateCanvasSize

      public static void updateCanvasSize(javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas activeCanvas, javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext graphContext, javafx.scene.control.Slider canvasSizeSlider)

      This method is used to update the size of the active canvas based on the position of the resizing slider. It normalizes the slider's range of -1 to +1, and uses it as a scaling factor for the base width and height to be multiplied by.

      Parameters:
      activeCanvas - the active canvas to be resized.
      graphContext - the graphics context of the active canvas.
      canvasSizeSlider - the slider for resizing the canvas.
      Since:
      2.3.1

    • helpShow

      public static void helpShow(javafx.scene.control.TabPane pane)

      This method is simply used to display a help and about dialogue window when the user requests it from the drop down menu.

      Parameters:
      pane - the TabPane for the dialogue window to be displayed within.
